abstract.p: Scott Towne letter on Michael Lewis's August 13 article lauds fact that new televisions will give him ability to filter content and ads his son sees (S)

block.p: Lewis's article reveals exhilarating prospects. I can't help thinking of my 6-year-old son, who stays glued to the set during pitches for Pokemon Pop-Tarts and the like. But the box will give me the ability to change all that. My parental powers will now include the ability to filter content and the ads he sees. There follows the dilemma of whether I should steer my little consumer toward the programming and products I want him to see, creating a kind of consumer clone of myself.
